titleStmt.title: The Cony-catching bride who after she was privately married in a conventicle or chamber, according to the new fashion of marriage, she sav'd her selfe very handsomely from being coney-caught ... : together with a sermon preached by a pragmaticall cobler at the aforesaid wedding comparing the duties of marriage to the utensils of his trade.

The Cony-catching bride who after she was privately married in a conventicle or chamber, according to the new fashion of marriage, she sav'd her selfe very handsomely from being coney-caught ... : together with a sermon preached by a pragmaticall cobler at the aforesaid wedding comparing the duties of marriage to the utensils of his trade.

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of original in Huntington Library.
